info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 4:44PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Freezing rain will impact portions of northern Clinton, northeastern Franklin, Grand Isle and northwestern Franklin Counties through 545 PM EST... At 439 PM EST, freezing rain was reported over northern Franklin and northern Clinton counties of New York, and could also be occurring over the northern Champlain Islands of Vermont and the Swanton area of northern Vermont. Surface temperatures in these locations remain below freezing and could stay that way for the next hour or so. HAZARD...Light freezing rain with accumulations from a trace to less than 0.05". SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Icy roads will make untreated surfaces dangerous for motorists and pedestrians. Locations impacted include... Chazy, Mooers, Altona, Alburgh Village, Ellenburg Depot, Champlain, Churubusco, Swanton, Grand Isle, South Alburgh, Alburgh, Alburgh Dunes State Park, North Hero, Swanton Village, Highgate Falls, Isle La Motte, Chateaugay, Rouses Point, Highgate and Burke. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 117 and 129.
info.instruction: The freezing rain may quickly coat roadways with a thin layer of ice that may be undetectable. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
